Issues.Title: style: enforce strict equality comparison
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [x] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
Both _equality comparison_ (`==` & `!=`) and _strict equality comparison_ (`===` & `!==`) are allowed to use, which violates [one](https://google.github.io/styleguide/jsguide.html#features-equality-checks) of our style guide rules.

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?
**Only** _strict equality comparison_ (`===` and `!==`), with the exception of `== null` and `!= null`, is allowed to use (enforced by the [triple-equal](https://palantir.github.io/tslint/rules/triple-equals/) TSLint rule).

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

With Ivy enabled, fails on both 8.x and 9.x. ### Description In a project using Angular 9, `HostListener` and `HostBinding` decorators are handled multiple times on child and grandchild components. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Here's a link to a repo with the reproduction: [https://github.com/ViktorSlavov/angular-inheritance-repo](https://github.com/ViktorSlavov/angular-inheritance-repo) Steps to reproduce: 1. Run the app and open the console. 2. Click on one of the components labeled `Child` - one entry is logged 7. Issues.Title: ngcc: runtime error with `ng6-breadcrumbs`
Issues.Body:
In [ng6-breadcrumbs][1], the entry-point for `package.json > main` (which is detected by `ngcc` as CommonJS format) has indeed most files in CommonJS format (e.g. [lib/breadcrumbs.module.js][2]), but the entry-point file is in ESM5 format ([ng6-breadcrumbs.js][3]).

`ngcc` compiles the entry-point correctly (possibly as a result of `CommonJsReflectionHost` extending `Ems5ReflectionHost`?), but fails to detect that `BreadcrumbsComponent` is exported as part of the `export * from './lib/breadcumbs.component'` export and adds a re-export for the `BreadcrumbsComponent`. Since `ngcc` considers this file to be in CommonJS format (as the whole entry-point), the export it adds looks like `exports.BreadcrumbsComponent = ...`.

The resulting file uses both ES module exports (`export * ...`) and CommonJS exports (`exports.Foo = ...`). As a result, webpack cannot bundle it correctly, treating it as an ES module and resulting in a runtime error: `exports is not defined`.

Open questions:
- [ ] Do we want to support that in `ngcc`?
- [ ] A quick-ish work-around (that would work in some cases, but not all) would be to change `ngcc` so that the `CommonJsReflectionHost` can recognize exports in ESM5 format. (So, in this case, it wouldn't re-add the `BredcrumbComponent` export?) <-- Needs to be verified.
- [ ] Is this a common pattern or is it just this one package?

[1]: https://www.npmjs.com/package/ng6-breadcrumbs
[2]: https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/ng6-breadcrumbs@1.0.7/lib/breadcrumbs.module.js
[3]: https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/ng6-breadcrumbs@1.0.7/ng6-breadcrumbs.js
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ngcc: runtime error with `ng6-breadcrumbs`" (#33297)

Issues.Title: fix(zone.js): work around TS3.7 issue
Issues.Body:
In TypeScript 3.7, circularity detection misfires on the declaration of `value` here.
https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/32950

Declaring an explicit type avoids the problem.

Issues.Title: BUG: IVY ViewChild does not work when defined in base class
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report

### Affected Package
`@angular/core`

### Is this a regression?

Definitely yes, it is working without IVY.

### Description

When you define `ViewChild` (probably same with `ViewChildren`, maybe even with `ContentChild`) in parent *base* class, this property will never be set by Angular.

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction

> `git clone https://github.com/kukjevov/ng-universal-demo.git`
> `cd ng-universal-demo`
> `git checkout ivy-error`
> `npm install`
> `npm start`
> open browser on `http://localhost:8888/garden`
> you should see undefined in console instead of requested instance of component

## 🔥 Exception or Error

No error just missing value of property with `ViewChild`

## 🌍  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
Angular 9-next.12

**Anything else relevant?**
Windows: 10.0.17763
Node: 11.6.0
NPM: 6.9.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "BUG: IVY ViewChild does not work when defined in base class" (#33292)

Issues.Title: No way to prevent angular-cli from removing license info from minified JS
Issues.Body:
I _believe_ this is a bug, although it's also possible that I've misunderstood the intended current behaviour and that this is in fact a feature request.

According to @IgorMinar in [this comment](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/33056#issuecomment-540821307):
> It is customary to preserve licensing information in application bundles in the form of js comments marked with @license js doc and that's what Angular CLI does. We currently don't offer a way to omit the inclusion of these headers in the application bundles.

This is _not_ the behaviour I am observing however. When I run `ng build --prod` using Angular CLI version 8.3.6, _all_ third party license info is _removed_ from the resulting minified JavaScript bundles and placed in `3rdpartylicenses.txt`.

If I run the same command with `--extractLicenses=false`, the license info is _still_ removed, but `3rdpartylicenses.txt` is not created.

There doesn't seem to be any way to _prevent_ Angular CLI from removing this license information from the JS that I am going to be serving in my application.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "No way to prevent angular-cli from removing license info from minified JS" (#33288)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): missing-injectable migration should handle forwardRef
Issues.Body:
Currently the migration is unable to migrate instances where
the provider definition uses `forwardRef`. Since this is a
common pattern, we should support that from within the migration.

The solution to the problem is adding a foreign function resolver
to the `PartialEvaluator`. This basically matches the usage of
the static evaluation that is used by the ngtsc annotations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(core): missing-injectable migration should handle forwardRef" (#33286)

Issues.Title: BUG: IVY change detection on push for component within ng-template not invalidated
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report

### Affected Package
@angular/core
@angular/common

### Is this a regression?

Yes definitely yes, it is working without ivy (Angular 8) without any problem.

### Description

When you have components set to `ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush` and you have component which obtains `TemplateRef` from its *content* using `ContentChild` for example, then you put component inside this template and change one of its inputs, change detection is not triggered inside this component and you can not see changes, since component inside has not invalidated its view.

If you put your component in `<ng-content>` it is working, but not with `<ng-template>`.

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction

Here is working version with Angular 8 without IVY
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-xfuujc

And here (branch *ivy-error*) is not working version with Angular 9-next.12 with IVY
https://github.com/kukjevov/ng-universal-demo

> `git clone https://github.com/kukjevov/ng-universal-demo.git`
> `cd ng-universal-demo`
> `git checkout ivy-error`
> `npm install`
> `npm start`
> open browser at `http://localhost:8888`

## 🔥 Exception or Error

There is one async change after 5 seconds to `data "bla bla"` and also it is possible to click on button which will cause change of displayed value. In stackblitz it is working, in provided repo it is not working.

## 🌍  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
Angular 9-next.12

**Anything else relevant?**
Windows: 10.0.17763
Node: 11.6.0
NPM: 6.9.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "BUG: IVY change detection on push for component within ng-template not invalidated" (#33285)

Issues.Title: perf(ivy): avoid unnecessary i18n pass while processing a template
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, we always invoked second i18n pass (in case whitespace removal is on, which is a default), even if a given template doesn't contain i18n information. Now we store a flag (that indicates presence of i18n information in a template) during first i18n pass and use it to check whether second pass is needed.

Issues.Title: Support for Closure Compiler in Angular CLI
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->


# 🚀 Feature request
This is based on the issue https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/2981

Here's a request to please add support for closure compiler in Angular CLI. 



### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->
```
- [x ] build
```

### Description
Since the bundles produced by Angular compiler are compatible with Closure compiler, therefore I believe it would be great if we could have the ability to compile our Angular applications using Closure compiler in Angular CLI.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Some flag in `angular.json` file that could allow us to use Closure compiler with `ng build` command.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Though I haven't tried it, but below post shows how this can be achieved using angular cli:

https://dev.to/steveblue/build-angular-like-an-architect-part-1-3ph2

What I am suggesting is ability to compile Angular applications using Closure Compiler with minimum efforts using Angular CLI.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support for Closure Compiler in Angular CLI" (#15901)

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

# 🚀 Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->
```
- [x] build
- [x] serve
```

### Description
Angular currently uses the slow compiled-to-pure-js implementation of dart-sass.
>The pure JS version is slower than the stand-alone executable (https://sass-lang.com/dart-sass)

### Describe the solution you'd like
There should be an option (in `angular.json`) to use the fast DartVM executable for dart-sass.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow dart-sass DartVM executable rather than pure-js." (#15899)

Issues.Title: "Can't resolve all parameters for" in @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.803.1+ for extended components
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) Error occurs at runtime (no problems reported from the compiler). ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 0.803.0 ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... After upgrade to @angular-devkit/build-angular: 0.803.12 from 0.802.2 "Can't resolve all parameters for" exceptions in runtime are happened. Exceptions are related to assigned constructors from base to derived classes, see code below. Also this exception is described in the anuglar repo [https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/24414#issuecomment-535451121](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/24414#issuecomment-535451121) ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction We have an abstract base class which looks like that: ``` export abstract class CommunicationFormComponent { constructor( private readonly changeDetectorRef: ChangeDetectorRef, ) { } } ``` From this class the following class is derived: ``` @Component({ changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush, providers: [{ multi: true, provide: CommunicationFormComponent, useExisting: forwardRef(() => PhoneFormComponent), }], selector: "tt-phone-form", styleUrls: ["./communication-form.component.scss"], templateUrl: "./communication-form.component.html", viewProviders: [ { provide: ControlContainer, useExisting: FormGroupDirective, }, ], }) export class PhoneFormComponent extends CommunicationFormComponent { } ``` If add constructor to class with @Component decorator, it works fine. ## 🔥 Exception or Error

Issues.Title: No way to prevent angular-cli from removing license info from minified JS
Issues.Body:
I _believe_ this is a bug, although it's also possible that I've misunderstood the intended current behaviour and that this is in fact a feature request.

According to @IgorMinar in [this comment](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/33056#issuecomment-540821307):
> It is customary to preserve licensing information in application bundles in the form of js comments marked with @license js doc and that's what Angular CLI does. We currently don't offer a way to omit the inclusion of these headers in the application bundles.

This is _not_ the behaviour I am observing however. When I run `ng build --prod` using Angular CLI version 8.3.6, _all_ third party license info is _removed_ from the resulting minified JavaScript bundles and placed in `3rdpartylicenses.txt`.

If I run the same command with `--extractLicenses=false`, the license info is _still_ removed, but `3rdpartylicenses.txt` is not created.

There doesn't seem to be any way to _prevent_ Angular CLI from removing this license information from the JS that I am going to be serving in my application.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "No way to prevent angular-cli from removing license info from minified JS" (#15890)

Issues.Title: Inconsistency behavior when handling errors
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ x ] serve - [ x ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No. ### Description ### Handling only syntax errors when it is not a first run It seems that `AngularCompilerPlugin` handles both syntactic and semantic errors on first run, but it handles only syntax errors when it is not the first run. https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/95776fed6713c3d911c876272cdb25c4e8fd3599/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/angular_compiler_plugin.ts#L1272-L1273 This lead to the following inconsistency behavior when executing `ng serve`: ### First run 1. Add the code below to `app.component.ts`: ``` public ngOnInit() { const x:number = '10'; console.log('============ x = ', x); } ``` 2. Execute `ng serve` **Actual behavior:** ``` ERROR in src/app/app.component.ts:12:11 - error TS2322: Type '"10"' is not assignable to type 'number'. 12 const x:number = '10'; ｢wdm｣: Failed to compile. ``` ### Not a first run 1. Execute `ng serve` 2. Add the code below to `app.component.ts`: ``` public ngOnInit() { const x:number = '10'; console.log('============ x = ', x); } ``` **Actual behavior:** ``` wdm｣: Compiled successfully. ERROR in src/app/app.component.ts(12,11): error TS2322: Type '"10"' is not assignable to type 'number'. ``` As it can be seen, the `webpack` compilation is not successful on first run but it is fine when it is not the first run. I'm wondering if this is the intended behavior and what is the reason for that behavior. Currently we're relying on `AngularCompilerPlugin` and in case it is intended behavior, is it possible to introduce an option so the diagnostics mode can be forced? That will give us the ability to handle both syntax and semantic errors regardless if it is first run or not. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction ## 🔥 Exception or Error

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): sockPath for custom path
Issues.Body:
Fixes #9146 # Issue ```bash # setup project ng new base-href-socket-path --style=css --inlineStyle=true --inlineTemplate=true --routing=false --minimal=true # Start server with baseHref and publicHost ng serve --baseHref="/my-app/" --publicHost="http://localhost:4200/my-app" ``` The auto-reload `sockjs-node/*` websocket requests fails with a 404: E.g. `curl http://localhost:4200/my-app/sockjs-node/info` returns: ```html > GET /my-app/sockjs-node/info HTTP/1.1 > Host: localhost:4200 > User-Agent: curl/7.54.0 > Accept: */* > < HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found < X-Powered-By: Express < Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * < Content-Security-Policy: default-src 'none' < X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff < Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8 < Content-Length: 162 < Date: Sat, 19 Oct 2019 13:43:22 GMT < Connection: keep-alive < Error 
Cannot GET /my-app/sockjs-node/info
``` setting webpack dev-servers [`sockPath`](https://webpack.js.org/configuration/dev-server/#devserversockpath) to connect to reloading socket via custom path when serving the app on a custom path. See https://github.com/micmro/angular-base-href-reload-socket-path-workaround for issue and a currently working workaround using `@angular-builders/custom-webpack`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): sockPath for custom path" (#15883)

Issues.Title: fix(schematics): secondary entry point migration not working against v9
Issues.Body:
Currently the secondary entry point migration uses the type checker to figure out which Material module a symbol belongs to. This won't work in v9, because we removed the top-level `@angular/material`. These changes fall back to looking up the name of the symbol in a list of known symbols and their module names.

Fixes #17433.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(schematics): secondary entry point migration not working against v9" (#17452)

Issues.Title: refactor(ng-update): run package manager upon migration completion
Issues.Body:
We cannot run the package-manager to refresh the lock file
synchronously. This is because the changes made to the
schematic tree are not applied until the actual task
completes. Hence we need to run the task asynchronously
upon migration completion. This ensures that the lock file
is properly updated if something changed the `package.json` file.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(ng-update): run package manager upon migration completion" (#17455)

Issues.Title: Enhance the mat-paginator so the total length can be masked.
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Provide the way to mask the 'total length'. 

#### Use Case

With large data set, getting the count from the backend database is slow. We'd like to mask the "total length", so the users can paginate without having to know the max length. The end user would be able to continue to paginate until there is no results from the backend. 

Two issues

1. You wouldn't know the actual max length.
2. If the last page set returns the same as the page size, then it would still allow to paginate to next page. However, there would be no results.


The end user who can live with these two issues can simply mask the total length by specifying the display label  such as "More" or "..."

Example.

200-300 (More) "<"  ">"
Or
200-300 (...) "<"  ">"

<mat-paginator [maskTotal]="true"  [maskTotalLabel]="'More'"
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Enhance the mat-paginator so the total length can be masked." (#17449)

Issues.Title: refactor: hammer migration should add "HammerModule" if needed
Issues.Body:
The v9 HammerJS migration should add the `HammerModule` to the
app module if needed.

Additionally if HammerJS is not used in templates (or in general),
we remove references to the "HammerModule". This scenario can happen
if someone updates to v9 Angular while keeping Angular Material v8. In
that case, the author will add the `HammerModule` to the app module and
whenever the update to v9+ Angular Material is performed, the `HammerModule`
is not needed anymore.. so we can remove it automatically.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor: hammer migration should add "HammerModule" if needed" (#17444)

Issues.Title: matTabLink `disabled` input should be `matTabLinkDisabled`
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-zju32k

Steps to reproduce:
1. Put a tooltip on a `matTabLink`
2. Disabled the `matTabLink`
 
#### Expected Behavior

Tab should be disabled, and tooltip should show.

#### Actual Behavior

Tooltip did not show.

#### Notes/Thoughts

If the input is changed to `matTabLinkDisabled`, then `disabled` and `[disabled]="true"` should still be able to work. However, it would also be possible to use `matTabLinkDisabled`, which would make it possible to disable the `MatTabLink` specifically, without disabling any other directive on the element.

I *believe* this would be a non breaking change, as the input is declared in the `inputs` field on component:

```typescript
@Directive({
  selector: '[mat-tab-link], [matTabLink]',
  exportAs: 'matTabLink',
  inputs: ['disabled', 'disableRipple', 'tabIndex'], // <== HERE
  host: {
    'class': 'mat-tab-link',
    '[attr.aria-current]': 'active ? "page" : null',
    '[attr.aria-disabled]': 'disabled',
    '[attr.tabIndex]': 'tabIndex',
    '[class.mat-tab-disabled]': 'disabled',
    '[class.mat-tab-label-active]': 'active',
  }
})
export class MatTabLink 
```
So *my understanding* is right now, you can’t read the disabled field by name anyways.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.11
- CDK/Material: 8.2.1
- Browser(s): Version 77.0.3865.120 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Debian Rodette
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "matTabLink `disabled` input should be `matTabLinkDisabled`" (#17446)

Issues.Title: Angular Material - Basic Carousel
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Initial basic carousel functionality that can be expanded on in future iterations. Basically the ability to choose the following:

- `perView` - sets items visible as the user navigates through the 
- `startsAt` - sets where the carousel should focus on init
- Arrows to move the carousel left/right

#### Use Case

The biggest benefit would be having this centralized in a community package that people can contribute to and support. Other benefits are not having to pull in dependencies like `jQuery` or vanilla packages that have issues with the lifecycle hooks of Angular.

Carousels are a very common component that people use in their Web applications. Would be awesome to see that hosted in Angular Material.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular Material - Basic Carousel" (#17437)

Issues.Title: Mat-Select scroll bar displayed off page or behind page scroll bar
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-xrksc1

screenshot: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49412779/67042316-a1941100-f0f5-11e9-81af-839b5fd6c224.png)


Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a mat-select component directly in the page body with enough options that a vertical scroll bar should appear. The scroll bar will display off-screen. (Example 1 in stackblitz, comment out the div.expand-page element)
2. Create a mat-select component, set it's width and float it right. Add enough options that the vertical scroll bar appears. Create a div below the mat-select element and set its height to 150vh to make a scroll bar appear on the body element. Now the mat-select component's scroll bar will be hidden behind the body elements scroll bar.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
The mat-select vertical scroll bar should always be visible if it exists.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
The mat-select scroll bar gets hidden either off-screen or behind other scroll bars

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.11
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Google Chrome: Version 77.0.3865.120 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10 Pro: version 1809

Issues.Title: Material Menu: inputs are not recognized in ivy mode
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

(StackBlitz doesn't seem to support ivy)

Steps to reproduce:
1. `npm install -g @angular/cli@next`
2. `ng new app`
3. `ng add @angular/material`
4. `ng update @angular/material --next`
5. Add a basic [menu example](https://material.angular.io/components/menu/examples) using `overlapTrigger` input:

```html
  <button mat-button [matMenuTriggerFor]="menu">Menu</button>
  <mat-menu #menu="matMenu" [overlapTrigger]="false">
    <button mat-menu-item>Item 1</button>
    <button mat-menu-item>Item 2</button>
  </mat-menu>
```

6. `ng build`
 
#### Expected Behavior

The build should pass.


#### Actual Behavior

```
ERROR in src/app/app.component.html:339:29 - error TS8002: Can't bind to 'overlapTrigger' since it isn't a known property of 'mat-menu'.
1. If 'mat-menu' is an Angular component and it has 'overlapTrigger' input, then verify that it is part of this module.
2. If 'mat-menu' is a Web Component then add 'CUSTOM_ELEMENTS_SCHEMA' to the '@NgModule.schemas' of this component to suppress this message.
3. To allow any property add 'NO_ERRORS_SCHEMA' to the '@NgModule.schemas' of this component.

339   <mat-menu #menu="matMenu" [overlapTrigger]="false">
                                ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

  src/app/app.component.ts:5:16
    5   templateUrl: './app.component.html',
                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    Error occurs in the template of component AppComponent.
```


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.0.0-next.11
- CDK/Material: 9.0.0-next.0
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Material Menu: inputs are not recognized in ivy mode" (#17434)
